page.title: 11Lympne Primary School
page.content: Lympne Church of England Primary School was opened in 1872 with approximately 15 children as a result of the 1870 Education Act which said that all children should receive a state education. It was built with funds supplied by the Church and was a one class school for children ranging in age from 5 to 14, the little ones sitting in the front and the older ones at the back. During the early days the children were mainly from homes of the farming community, and up until about 1920 they actually had a two week break to help with the harvest. The school presently has 91 children on the role, rising to approximately 110 at the end of the school year. Of these 91 children not one comes from a home which has any connection with farming.
